sentence.Network_en: The town council passed a law forbidding the distribution of handbills.
sentence.Network_cn: 市议会通过法律,禁止散发传单.

sentence.Network_en: The emperor issued an edict forbidding doing trade with foreigners.
sentence.Network_cn: 皇帝颁布了一项不得和外国人做生意的敕令.

sentence.Network_en: Parliament has passed an act forbidding the slaughter of animals for pleasure.
sentence.Network_cn: 议会通过了一项禁止杀生取乐的法令.

entry.def: If you describe a person, place, or thing as forbidding, you mean they have a severe, unfriendly, or threatening appearance.

example.ex: There was something a little severe and forbidding about her face.
example.tran: 她脸上有种严肃、冷峻的表情。

means.word_mean: 1. an official prohibition or edict against something
1. harshly uninviting or formidable in manner or appearance;

sentences.sentence: "a grim man loving duty more than humanity"
"undoubtedly the grimmest part of him was his iron claw"- J.M.Barrie

means.word_mean: 2. threatening or foreshadowing evil or tragic developments;

auth_sentence.content: I see no one forbidding anyone from exercising religion.
auth_sentence.res_content: I see no one forbidding anyone from exercising religion.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: I see no one forbidding anyone from exercising religion.

auth_sentence.content: It seemed cold and forbidding, like a showroom.

auth_sentence.res_content_con: It seemed cold and forbidding, like a showroom.

auth_sentence.content: We saw the same forbidding wall of belt-ice.
auth_sentence.res_content: We saw the same forbidding wall of belt-ice.

Sentence.sentence: Forbidding students to take food out of the restaurant.
